Sentencas: Degradation of electrode microstructure is one of the key factors affecting long term performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell systems.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy

Sentencas: Evolution of a multiphase system can be described quantitatively by the change in its interfacial energy.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy

Sentencas: In this paper, we discuss free energy of a microstructure to showcase the anisotropy of its evolution during a long-term performance experiment involving an SOFC stack.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy

Sentencas: Ginzburg Landau type functional is used to compute the free energy, using diffuse phase distributions based on Focused Ion Beam Scanning Electron Microscopy images of samples taken from nine different sites within the stack.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy

Sentencas: It is shown that the rate of microstructure evolution differs depending on the position within the stack, similar to phase anisotropy.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy

Sentencas: However, the computed spatial relation does not correlate with the observed distribution of temperature.
Titulo: Microstructure Evolution in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack Quantified with Interfacial Free Energy
